question: 刺す
sourceAnswer: to{} pierce/stab/prick/stick/thrust | sting/bite | sew/stitch/embroider | pole-(a-boat) | catch-(with-a-limed-pole) | put-(a-runner)-out/pick-off
sourceMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. 

The kanji itself means <kanji>stab</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to stab</vocabulary>.

This is a transitive verb, meaning that you are the one doing the stabbing... should I be afraid of you? 😅
sourceReadingMnemonic: If you're going <vocabulary>to stab</vocabulary> someone, use a <reading>saw</reading> (<ja>さ</ja>). It may seem more difficult to stab them with a saw at first, but when you see the damage, plus how hard it is to get back out, you'll realize a saw is the ideal stabbing tool.
